trans-unit.source: Using resources with multiple versions
trans-unit.target: Using resources with multiple versions

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: In PowerShell 5.0, DSC resources can have multiple versions, and versions can be installed on a computer side-by-side.
trans-unit.target: In PowerShell 5.0, DSC resources can have multiple versions, and versions can be installed on a computer side-by-side.

trans-unit.source: This is implemented by having multiple versions of a resource module
trans-unit.target: This is implemented by having multiple versions of a resource module

trans-unit.source: that are contained in the same module folder.
trans-unit.target: that are contained in the same module folder.

trans-unit.source: Installing multiple resource versions side-by-side
trans-unit.target: Installing multiple resource versions side-by-side

trans-unit.source: You can use the **MinimumVersion**, **MaximumVersion**, and **RequiredVersion** parameters of the [Install-Module](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn807162.aspx) cmdlet to specify
trans-unit.target: You can use the **MinimumVersion**, **MaximumVersion**, and **RequiredVersion** parameters of the [Install-Module](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn807162.aspx) cmdlet to specify

trans-unit.source: which version of a module to install.
trans-unit.target: which version of a module to install.

trans-unit.source: Calling **Install-Module** without specifying a version installs the most recent version.
trans-unit.target: Calling **Install-Module** without specifying a version installs the most recent version.

trans-unit.source: For example, there are multiple versions of the **xFailOverCluster** module, each of which contains an **xCluster** resouce.
trans-unit.target: For example, there are multiple versions of the **xFailOverCluster** module, each of which contains an **xCluster** resouce.

trans-unit.source: The result of calling **Install-Module** without specifying the
trans-unit.target: The result of calling **Install-Module** without specifying the

trans-unit.source: version number is as follows:
trans-unit.target: version number is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Now, if you call **Install-Module** again, but specify a **RequiredVersion** of 1.1.0.0, it results in the following:
trans-unit.target: Now, if you call **Install-Module** again, but specify a **RequiredVersion** of 1.1.0.0, it results in the following:

trans-unit.source: Specifying a resource version in a configuration
trans-unit.target: Specifying a resource version in a configuration

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple resources installed on a computer, you must specify the version of that resource when you use it in a configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple resources installed on a computer, you must specify the version of that resource when you use it in a configuration.

trans-unit.source: You do this by specifying the **ModuleVersion**
trans-unit.target: You do this by specifying the **ModuleVersion**

trans-unit.source: parameter of the **Import-DscResource** keyword.
trans-unit.target: parameter of the **Import-DscResource** keyword.

trans-unit.source: If you fail to specify the version of a resource module of a resource of which you have more than one version installed, the configuration
trans-unit.target: If you fail to specify the version of a resource module of a resource of which you have more than one version installed, the configuration

trans-unit.source: generates an error.
trans-unit.target: generates an error.

trans-unit.source: The following configuration shows how to specify the version of the resource to call:
trans-unit.target: The following configuration shows how to specify the version of the resource to call:

trans-unit.source: Note: The ModuleVersion parameter of Import-DscResource is not available in PowerShell 4.0.
trans-unit.target: Note: The ModuleVersion parameter of Import-DscResource is not available in PowerShell 4.0.

trans-unit.source: In PowerShell 4.0, you can specify a module version by passing a module specification
trans-unit.target: In PowerShell 4.0, you can specify a module version by passing a module specification

trans-unit.source: object to the ModuleName parameter of Import-DscResource.
trans-unit.target: object to the ModuleName parameter of Import-DscResource.

trans-unit.source: A module specification object is a hashtable that contains ModuleName and RequiredVersion keys.
trans-unit.target: A module specification object is a hashtable that contains ModuleName and RequiredVersion keys.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: This will also work in PowerShell 5.0, but it is recommended that you use the **ModuleVersion** parameter.
trans-unit.target: This will also work in PowerShell 5.0, but it is recommended that you use the **ModuleVersion** parameter.
